instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message:
Hello,  
I  have received  a MacBook 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  it is not powering on due  to water damage. where should I start diagnosing from ? when I  plug the power in should I get power readings or i have to jump start it to get  readings ? if i need to jump start what pins i need to jump start ?

Thannks

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message: Where is the liquid damage? <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message: U have checks <CHIP>U5420</CHIP> Pin 4 and 3 for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> there is no power reading there do i have to jump the system to get power?

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message: <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> Is where most of the corruption is LP8548B1SQ_-04

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> is backlight IC, so nothing to worry about until PPBUS is back. 

Voltage on F7000 and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message:
F7000 Has no Voltage
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> broke off when i touched it, what board uses the same R i can remove from to reuse ? :) 
Pin 2 on <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> is 5.25V

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message: Only the newer board use those type of resistors, so from 00045 and newer. Get some donor boards 00244, 00875 or something.

MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message: i was referring to the cap :) i have seen these they will take forever to come

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message: Just get some boards, I'm pretty sure you will need more parts from them.

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message: Jut got some Boards Replaced <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> still  there is no power on F7000  <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> pin 2 has 5.25V. i think the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is not coming in. any comments ?

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message:
You think PPBUS is not coming on? Why not measure it?

Where was the original corrosion? Any around the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips?

threads.title: MacBook 13" 2017 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Wateer Damage
threads.message:
Duke; 
here are some  readings 
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>  @<RESISTOR>R9920</RESISTOR>  Pin 2 has  5.3  volt
<CAPACITOR>C6482</CAPACITOR>  HAS ZERO VOLT
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL>   0.2 VOLT
<RESISTOR>R7075</RESISTOR> HAS 0V

HOPE THIS HELPS IDENTIFY  THE ISSUE
